llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach (value=1; SHAP=+2.87879): the payment being ACH is the single largest positive contributor to the model score, strongly increasing the likelihood of a flag.
- dayofweek (value=6; SHAP=+0.621813): the transaction occurring on day 6 (Sunday) produced an additional positive contribution to the score.
- payment_currency_saudi_riyal (value=1; SHAP=+0.606203): the payment currency being Saudi Riyal increased the score.
- from_bank (value=119; SHAP=-0.428745) and to_bank (value=49365; SHAP=-0.304935): these sending/receiving bank identifiers decreased the score and partially offset the positive contributions above.

Conclusion:
- The main reason the transaction was flagged is the strong positive contribution from payment_format_ach together with additional increases from dayofweek=6 and payment_currency_saudi_riyal; the from_bank and to_bank features reduced the score but did not fully offset the positive drivers (net contribution â‰ˆ +3.37 from the listed drivers).
- Conditional observation (derived from the named drivers): transactions with payment_format_ach=1, especially when occurring on dayofweek=6 and in payment_currency_saudi_riyal=1, will tend to raise the model score and are more likely to be flagged by this model.
